channel.title: Ann Arbor Downtown Development Authority on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Ann Arbor Downtown Development Authority on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: R, me hearties
item.description: I've been fond of maps and graphs for a long time, but haven't had a good set of tools to play with that easily generate decent versions of same from various data sets I've found or accumulated. The small hope is that a little bit of hacking on the right tools will fix this. One of the tools of choice is R, a language for statistics and data analysis. It's tremendously powerful and a bit complicated, but I'm not trying to learn the whole thing; rather, I'm after just the barest minimum so that I can competently generate a scatterplot of data and place it onto a map.

item.title: Psychedelic Rangers, Ann Arbor, 1972
item.description: The Ann Arbor Downtown Development Authority is considering hiring "downtown ambassadors" to patrol city streets, help out visitors, and keep the downtown neat and clean and welcoming. As a counterpoint to this corporatized welcoming function, I give you the Psychedelic Rangers, a project of the Rainbow People's Party (1972) which provided security to concerts and generally kept the peace without bringing in the law.
